channel.title: AI-Pulse - IoT - Internet of Things
channel.description: IoT - Internet of Things news from AI-Pulse

item.title: Adam Savage Meets a Real-Life Wall-E Robot!
item.description: Adam Savage’s Tested shared this video on Youtube Adam finally meets a real-life Wall-E robot! Robot and droid builder Matt Hobbs brings his incredible remote controlled Wall-E to Adam’s workshop to show off the latest advances in the Wall-E builder’s group and the Kyber Control System used to puppeteer and bring this beloved character to […]

item.title: No Tools for You: A Century of Men Policing Women’s Tools
item.description: A woman used a tool, shared what she made, it might even save her some time, and then some men lost their minds. This is not a new story. In 1925, Dr. Guy Manning stood before a medical conference in New York City and declared that vacuum cleaners and dishwashers were “making housewives lazy.” The […]

item.title: I gave Claude access to my pen plotter
item.description: Marc in Space at Harmonique.one gave Claude Code access to a pen plotter. Not directly. I was the interface between the two machines. Claude Code produced SVG files that I plotted with my pen plotter. With my smartphone I captured photos that I pasted into the Claude Code session, asking Claude what it thought about […]

item.title: A program to monitor serial ports in Windows
item.description: lucadentella states “I don’t know if it happens to you: every time I need to connect to a USB device that opens a virtual serial port (e.g., an Arduino board, a USB-to-serial adapter, etc.), I waste a lot of time trying to figure out which COMx port the device corresponds to in Windows.” So they […]

item.title: CircuitPython 10.1.0 Released!
item.description: From the GitHub release page: This is CircuitPython 10.1.0, the latest minor revision of CircuitPython, and is a new stable release. This release is identical to 10.1.0-rc.0 except for its version number. Notable changes in 10.1.0 from 10.0.x Add mipidsi module to support MIPI DSI displays. Currently enabled for ESP32-P4. Fix problems with presenting user-mounted […]

item.title: Reverse engineering the Dash learning robot
item.description: Jonathan Diamond brushed up on Ghidra to add to the open source interface for a Dash robot found at a thrift shop. Much to their credit, the MakeWonder company released an official Python library: https://github.com/playi/WonderPy It breaks out all the controls and sensors in a reasonable way. Here’s the documentation of the features it covers. This would […]

item.title: New York City in Minecraft
item.description: MineFact shared a tour their New York City in Minecraft project on YouTube, follow along to see what BTE NYC and MF have built at a 1:1 scale over the last 5 years. Circuit Playground Minecraft Gesture Controller Minecraft Turbopad

item.title: Romantic Reads for V-Day
item.description: The New York Public Library shares new romance books to get your heart burning this Valentine’s Day.

item.title: Month-Long Sale Event Starts Next Week!
item.description: Y’all ready for this? We’re starting our first ever month-long sale event next week! Each week we’ll be putting items on sale from a different product category. Items available while supplies last. We’ll list the sale price directly on the product page for ya – no discount code needed. Stay tuned for updates!

item.title: Daisy Gatson Bates Day Black History Month 2026 #BlackHistoryMonth #DaisyGatsonBatesDay
item.description: Daisy Lee Gatson Bates was a civil rights activist who played an integral role in the integration of Arkansas schools. She was a mentor to the Little Rock Nine, she and her husband also published the Arkansas State Press a revolutionary newspaper that dealt with civil rights and other issues in the black community. From Arkansas PBS: Daisy […]

item.title: Object detection with Ultralytics YOLO26 on Raspberry Pi
item.description: Use Docker and Ultralytics YOLO26 to perform object detection on images and video files with Raspberry Pi. The post Object detection with Ultralytics YOLO26 on Raspberry Pi appeared first on Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Building a Desk Sized Kodak Photo Kiosk
item.description: snappiness built a mini Kodak Picture Maker for their desk that is able to print photos and shared the project build on YouTube Grab a MEMENTO when they’re back in stock so you can have even more photos to print!

item.title: Susan B. Anthony Day 20216 #SusanBAnthony #SusanBAnthonyDay
item.description: Today is Susan B. Anthony Day. We celebrate on February 15th, what would be her 206th birthday! Anthony was an American social reformer, women’s rights activist, and brilliant orator who played a pivotal role in the women’s suffrage movement. In her last speech ended with the words “Failure is impossible!” Honor her legacy and vote! […]

item.title: Here’s Our First Gemini Deep Think LLM-Assisted Hardware Design
item.description: We’ve been using LLMs for years to do software and firmware assistance. Now we’re starting to look at it for hardware help too. Ladyada’s still in the driver’s seat… but now with a robotic co-pilot! For this basic STEMMA QT breakout we’re going to feature the MAX44009 wide-range lux sensor, aaaand we really wanted to […]

item.title: Twisted Heart Vase #3DPrinting
item.description: Gyrobot‘s 2013 twisted heart vase print may be the perfect gift for your Valentine! Check out the instructions on Thingiverse. Another heart, another vase, but with a twist. Give something presented in this “thing” and offer your heart forever(ish). Watch my twisted heart change colour : http://youtu.be/vf1HOLNgc1w Good for Valentines.

item.title: Adafruit Weekly Editorial Round-Up: Full-circle Test-driven Firmware Development with OpenClaw, Hacking Yoto Music Players, & More
item.description: ADAFRUIT WEEKLY EDITORIAL ROUND-UP We’ve got so much happening here at Adafruit that it’s not always easy to keep up! Don’t fret, we’ve got you covered. Each week we’ll be posting a handy round-up of what we’ve been up to, ranging from learn guides to blog articles, videos, and more. “Any User Who Has a […]

item.title: MakeCode Arcade 2026 Update
item.description: It’s update time for MakeCode Arcade! Microsoft just posted the latest news on the latest features added to the excellent drag-and-drop (or text code-able if you like) game creation engine. Here are some highlights: Reliability & Stability Code Evaluation Error Explainer Tutorial Sharing Keyboard Controls Game Description Asset Packs Tilemap Gallery YouTube Education video player […]

item.title: Meta Wants to Scan Every Face You Walk Past
item.description: The New York Times reported yesterday that Meta plans to add facial recognition to its Ray-Ban smart glasses, possibly this year. The feature, internally called “Name Tag,” (face rape is for another product) would let wearers identify people through Meta’s AI assistant. Seven million pairs sold last year. An internal Meta document from May, obtained […]

item.title: Making Lamps with Bamboo and Paper
item.description: Anyone in need of a super chill and aesthetic DIY build video is going to adore PearFleur’s bamboo and paper lamp build on YouTube. We have a selection of lamp builds in the Adafruit Learning System. Check out the two builds below that give us similar vibes to PearFleur’s creations. Hacking Ikea Lamps with Circuit […]

item.title: From PDF to .LBR: Using Deep Think to Write Custom CAD Parts
item.description: This is the image that Deep Think generated to demonstrate its output, the QFN corner pads don’t have as bad of an intersection in the actual footprint created but we did need to push the four rows out about half a mm. The overall dimensions, pad sizes and order were otherwise correct! It happened over […]

item.title: Agentic AI Chip Design, Networking Chip, Edge AI: Embedded Week Insights
item.description: Here's a roundup of this week's must-read articles. We look into the latest developments on Cadence Agentic AI, Cisco's Silicon One G300 Switch, Microchip's full-stack edge AI solutions, and more. Also, check News Archives - Embedded and Technical Articles Archives - Embedded for the complete list of news and articles from our website. NEWS Cisco Unveils Silicon One G300 [...] The post Agentic AI Chip Design, Networking Chip, Edge AI: Embedded Week Insights appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: LEGO Toaster
item.description: BricksOnSet shared this really cool LEGO toaster they debuted at Atlanta BrickCon on Reddit. Check it out! I debuted it this past weekend at Atlanta BrickCon and it won the Master Brick award. There’s a round gear on the toast that engages a straight gear on the front carriage as it goes down. It locks […]

item.title: John Park’s CircuitPython Parsec: Trellis Line Fill
item.description: #circuitpythonparsec Fill a line of NeoPixels between two end points on NeoTrellis driver boards (or MechaTrellis as shown here — currently sold out, but open source). code example To learn about CircuitPython: https://circuitpython.org

item.title: Custom Modded Friday the 13th Arcade 1up Cabinet #piday #raspberrypi
item.description: Happy Friday the 13th! A couple years back Reddit user u/valentino_42 took a Mortal Kombat II 1up Arcade and upgraded it to a RetroPie Friday the 13th cabinet: The guts of the machine are a Raspberry Pi 5 that interfaces with usb encoders going to the buttons. I’d never worked with a pi before, but I followed […]

item.title: Teenage Engineering EP-40 Teardown
item.description: Here’s a terrific teardown of the Teenage Engineering portable sample station, the EP-40 Riddim. The line of EP samplers are in many ways the evolution of the minimalist Pocket Operator series (which are as barebones as can be) and this post and accompanying video take a fantastic deep dive into the mechanical engineering of the […]

item.title: Babylon 5 Is now free to watch on YouTube #SciFi #Space
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery has begun uploading full episodes of the iconic series Babylon 5 to YouTube, providing free access to the show just as it departs from the ad-supported streaming platform Tubi. The uploads started with the pilot episode, “The Gathering,” which serves as the entry point to the series’ intricate universe. This was followed […]

item.title: Broadband IoT vs. Narrowband IoT: Enterprise Connectivity Strategies for 2026 and Beyond
item.description: This article compares broadband and narrowband IoT for enterprises in 2026, detailing technologies like LTE-M, NB-IoT, 5G RedCap, and satellite NTN to guide connectivity strategy decisions. The post Broadband IoT vs. Narrowband IoT: Enterprise Connectivity Strategies for 2026 and Beyond appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Mega Man’s Mega Buster
item.description: Super cool pi-pico-powered build from maker Arnov Sharma! Bonus points for using code from the Adafruit Neopixel Library. Check out more details on YouTube here and on Instructables here: This is a fully working replica. I started by modeling the Mega Buster in Fusion 360 and then integrated electronics inside to replicate both the plasma […]

item.title: What to Make with Adalogger FeatherWing
item.description: A Feather board without ambition is a Feather board without FeatherWings! This is the Adalogger FeatherWing: it adds both a battery-backed Real Time Clock and micro SD card storage to any Feather main board. This FeatherWing will make it real easy to add datalogging to any of our existing Feathers. You get both an I2C […]

item.title: Deutsche Telekom unveils multi-orbit IoT roaming
item.description: Deutsche Telekom introduces multi-orbit IoT roaming, combining GEO and LEO satellite coverage with terrestrial networks to deliver reliable, global NB-IoT connectivity for various IoT applications across remote and challenging environments. The post Deutsche Telekom unveils multi-orbit IoT roaming appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: How SPAD Imaging Improves Perception in Industrial Robotics
item.description: SPAD sensors are an alternative imaging solution for embedded industrial robotics systems thanks to their photon-level imaging. The post How SPAD Imaging Improves Perception in Industrial Robotics appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Inventor John Lee Love #BlackHistoryMonth
item.description: Via Biography John Lee Love was an African American inventor best known for patenting a portable pencil sharpener known as the “Love Sharpener. … Little is known about the life of John Lee Love, the inventor of the portable pencil sharpener. It is speculated that he was born some time during the reconstruction period – […]

item.title: Certifying third-party antennas for use with Raspberry Pi Compute Modules

item.description: NsDario shares: “Dead men tell no tales…” Give your printer a challenge worthy of the Seven Seas! This isn’t your average 3DBenchy; this is the Cursed Caribbean Edition, inspired by the legendary ghost ships of the deep. Featuring a highly detailed realistic wood plank texture, gothic windows, and sinister skull ornaments, this model is designed […]

item.title: Tasking Announces Integrated Embedded Software Toolchain
item.description: On the first anniversary of its acquisition of LDRA, Tasking has announced the availability of its integrated toolchain. Following the successful unification of LDRA and Tasking technologies, the combined solution delivers end-to-end capabilities combining compilation, debugging, and testing within a single development environment. AI-assisted features further support the accelerated development of functionally safe and secure [...] The post Tasking Announces Integrated Embedded Software Toolchain appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Dremel Dust Cover #3DThursday #3DPrinting
item.description: starletzzang shares: It was designed to prevent sanding powder, dust, and foreign matter from splashing directly onto your face, eyes, and other surfaces when sanding small objects. The Dremel dust cover can be folded or opened. We found that the Dremel dust cover interfered with the grinding of deep-hole parts, so we made it movable […]

item.title: Building the ultimate turntable for 3D scanning
item.description: When you buy a 3D scanner, it will probably come with a turntable to spin the subject part and help you get a consistent scan from all sides. But almost all of those turntables are flimsy, shaky, and lack any fixturing provisions for parts, diminishing their utility. That’s why Chris Borge used an Arduino to […] The post Building the ultimate turntable for 3D scanning appeared first on Arduino Blog.

item.title: Chess Set Medieval Stylized #3DPrinting #3DThursday
item.description: 29FLO shared this project on MakerWorld This time, I present a chess set inspired by Medieval aesthetics. If possible, print them in resin! The pieces have a lot of fine details. Although even an FDM print with a 0.4mm nozzle and 0.08–0.1mm layer height came out very nicely. Download files: https://makerworld.com/en/models/2369162-chess-set-medieval-stylized#profileId-2592908 Every Thursday is #3dthursday […]

item.title: Air Quality Monitor Station #3DThursday #3DPrinting
item.description: 21CNCStudio shares: Project Aura is an open‑source, ESP32‑based air quality monitoring station designed for everyday home use. It combines industrial‑grade sensors, a large touch display, and full local integration with Home Assistant — without cloud dependencies and without soldering. This crowdfunding campaign gives backers access to the complete build ecosystem: 3D‑printable enclosure files, detailed step‑by‑step […]

item.title: Seco to Demo IoT and Software Framework at Embedded World
item.description: Seco will showcase Clea, its IoT and AI software framework, at embedded world 2026, through a series of interactive demonstrations. The modular software framework simplifies the adoption of edge AI at scale by connecting hardware, software, and AI into a single, production-ready ecosystem. It supports the entire edge AI process from application development to deployment [...] The post Seco to Demo IoT and Software Framework at Embedded World appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Netmore Launches Pulse Partner Program for IoT Growth

item.title: A C implementation of the inference pipeline for the Mistral AI’s Voxtral Realtime 4B model
item.description: Voxtral Realtime 4B Pure C Implementation is a C implementation of the inference pipeline for the Mistral AI’s Voxtral Realtime 4B model. It has zero external dependencies beyond the C standard library. The MPS inference is decently fast, while the BLAS acceleration is usable but slow (it continuously convert the bf16 weights to fp32). Audio processing […]
